meta.content: Hempfield Area School District serves students and is located in Greensburg, PA.

div.div: The Monday, April 20, 2020, school board meeting of the Hempfield Area School District Board of School Directors will be a virtual meeting beginning at 7:00 PM. Click here for more information.

Eight counties in the Southern Alleghenies and Laurel Highlands are conducting a broadband feasibility study to determine the best path to a comprehensive broadband network in our region. Click here for more information.

Please click here to be directed to the HASD Coronavirus Information Page. This page contains all HASD District Communication, Technology Support, Food Service, and Special Education Information, in addition to other important resources

h3.a: Letter from the Superintendent Dated April 13, 2020

div.div: Please read the music letter for grade 5 students going to grade 6. It is important to fill out the survey that is linked in the letter.

h3.a: Hempfield Area High School Students provide video for younger Spartans

div.div: More than seventy Hempfield Area High School students created a video for younger Spartans to help them get through this difficult time. Their collaboration benefits all students, staff, and families as we remain positive during this challenging time. We thank Gianna Richason and all students involved!
Please see the attached letter from the Superintendent regarding policies and procedures for the use of cameras on school issued Chromebooks.
Click here for information regarding Kindergarten Registration

h3.a: Urgent Message from ACT - Information from our Counseling Office

div.div: April 4th's Testing Date Reschedule - Read More....

Hempfield Area School District, the largest in Westmoreland County, with a resident population of over 51,000, covers approximately ninety-five square miles and lies thirty miles southeast of Pittsburgh. The school district is comprised of Hempfield Township and the boroughs of Adamsburg, Hunker, Manor, New Stanton and Youngwood, and surrounds the city of Greensburg.

The Hempfield Area School District, in its commitment to excellence, shall engage and educate all students for personal success through a shared responsibility with the student, family, and community in a safe, secure and nurturing environment.

a.span: #2 in Westmoreland County for SAT Scores
Part of the 8th annual AP District Honor Roll
Meg Jones selected as part of the United States Senate Youth Progam, one of only 2 with the honor in Pennsylvania.
